reviewText: As a sequel series, it managed to work rather well utilizing  elements from The original series and continuing  to explore  them a bit more with this series, but at the same time its like they attempted to capture lightning in a bottle again, and while the series starts off strongly, it doesn't end particularly strongly.

JN Productions which brought Japanese super heroes to the children of Hawaii in the 1970s brought them to a new generation with their release of Jinzo Ningen Kikaida (starting in 2002) and Kamen Rider V3 (2005) and now Kikaida 01. And nobody does it better. Kikaida 01 looks better than it did back in 1973. You can watch every episode in their orignal Japanese with English subtitles, expletives deleted English subtitles (for the children) or without subtitles. There aren't as many extras as with the Kikaida set but what there is fun and informative. Don't forget to search for "easter eggs". We can only hope that JN Productions latest release isn't their last. "Change, Kikaida 01!"
